Module com.example.miniproyecto4
Package com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto4.model.Player.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPlayer, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerPlayer
public class Player extends Object implements IPlayer, Serializable
Represents a player in the Battleship game. Manages player information including nickname, game board, and ship sinking statistics. Implements Serializable to support game state persistence.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String nickname)
      Constructs a Player with the specified nickname. Initializes the player with a new game board and zero sunk ships.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's nickname

    • Player

      public Player(String nickname, IBoard board)
      Constructs a Player with the specified nickname and board. Initializes the player with the provided game board and zero sunk ships.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's nickname
      board - the game board to use for this player

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Checks if the player has lost the game. A player loses when all of their ships have been sunk.
      Specified by:
      hasLost in interface IPlayer
      Returns:
      true if all ships on the player's board are sunk, false otherwise

    • incrementSunkShips

      public void incrementSunkShips()
      Increments the count of ships that this player has sunk. Called when the player successfully sinks an opponent's ship.
      Specified by:
      incrementSunkShips in interface IPlayer

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the player to their initial state. Clears the board and resets the sunk ships count to zero.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface IPlayer
